be.docarch.odt2braille
Class Checker

java.lang.Object
  be.docarch.odt2braille.Checker

public class Checker
extends java.lang.Object

With this class a document can be checked for possible accessibility issues. You can

  • check the braille Settings,
  • check the flat .odt file generated by OpenOffice.org,
  • check the intermediate daisy-like files generated by Odt2Daisy, and
  • check the volume lengths of the resulting braille document.
The Checker entity collects all of this information and uses it to generating warnings.

Author:
Bert Frees

checkVolumes

public void checkVolumes(java.util.ArrayList<Volume> volumes)
Check the volume lengths of the resulting braille document for possible accessibility issues. The volumes should not be too long or too short, and they should not differ to much in lenght.

Parameters:
bodyPageCount - The number of pages in the body of each volume. The other parameters should have the same array length.
preliminaryPageCount - The number of preliminary pages in each volume.
volumeTypes - The type of each volume (Volume.VolumeType.NORMAL, Volume.VolumeType.PRELIMINARY or Volume.VolumeType.SUPPLEMENTARY).

getFirstWarning

public java.lang.String getFirstWarning()
Generate a first warning. This warning concerns issues that have been checked by checkFlatOdtFile and checkSettings

Returns:
The warning, or an empty String if no issues were detected.

getSecondWarning

public java.lang.String getSecondWarning()
Generate a second warning. This warning concerns issues that have been checked by checkDaisyFile and checkVolumeLengths

Returns:
The warning, or an empty String if no issues were detected.
